item.title: Report X-2024050537
item.description:
Report X-2024050537

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found already damage wet and leaking on trailer # 840477 upon inspection of inner content 4 x 4 L glass bottles of isopropanol alcohol 1 x 4 L glass bottle was cracked allowing all 4 L to leak out package had no slotted partitions or absorbent was found Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024050247
item.description:
Report E-2024050247

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a leaking lid on a 55-gallon poly drum containing SaniDate 5.0. The lid appeared to be not sealed tight enough or not sealed correctly. This resulted in an estimated 1-cup release of product onto the top of the poly drum, the plastic shrink-wrap, and cardboard. A Contractor removed the impacted plastic shrink wrap and cardboard and submerged them in water. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon DF. In total, 2 drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
